A merchant is auctioning a cursed amulet. It attracts ghosts. Protect the auction house from the spectral intruders so the merchant can sell the item and make it someone else's problem.
Protect the village's only Healer while she gathers herbs in the Wolf Woods. She is elderly and walks very slowly. Keep the wolves away while she inspects every single leaf.
Protect the ice-fishing tournament participants. A giant kraken (or a very big squid) is rumored to be under the ice. Ensure the fishermen catch fish, not the other way around.
success: The contest was safe! The winner was a snowman shaped like a dragon. The Judge was unharmed. We were paid in hot cocoa and gold. Justice was served, cold and firm.
The flower bloomed! It was beautiful and released glowing seeds. The botanist collected them all. We squashed a few bugs, but the plant is safe. A profitable night of gardening.
Silence was maintained. The Bard wrote 'Symphony of the Snow'. It's actually quite good. He paid us for our menacing shushing skills. The town is quiet, and the art is safe.
The buffet was saved! We held the dwarves back with shields until the elves got their salad. The banquet went smoothly. We were allowed to eat the leftovers. Delicious victory.
The dam is fixed! The workers finished the job without being eaten. The river monsters were whacked back into the water. The town is safe from flooding, and we got a nice paycheck.
The suit is clean! A pie was thrown, but a hero caught it in mid-air and ate it. The crowd cheered. The Mayor finished his boring speech. We are local heroes.
The cat woke up, stretched, and ate a treat. Not a single hair was shaved. The rival guild gave up seeing our heavy weapons. The mascot remains fluffy and arrogant.
The auction was a success! We fought off three ghosts and a poltergeist. The amulet was sold to a spooky-looking guy. The merchant is rich, and the ghosts followed the buyer. Perfect.
The Healer got her herbs. She didn't even notice the wolves because we killed them quietly in the bushes. She gave us a bag of healing salves and some hard candy. Sweet.
The tournament finished! Someone caught a prize trout. The kraken bumped the ice once, but we stomped on it until it left. No fishermen were eaten. A good day for the sport.
loses: A riot broke out. Someone hid a rock in a snowball. The Judge was knocked out. The contest was cancelled. We failed to keep the peace and are now banned from the winter carnival.
A hero fell asleep. A thief stole the flower pot. Or maybe a bug ate it. Either way, the greenhouse is empty. The botanist is screaming. We are hiding in the tool shed.
A dog barked. The Bard lost his concentration and threw his lute at the hero. The masterpiece is ruined. He wrote a diss track about us instead. Our reputation is ruined musically.
The line broke. The dwarves swarmed the table. The roast beast was gone in seconds. The elves arrived to empty plates and declared war. We caused a famine and a political crisis.
The monsters swarmed the scaffold. The workers dropped their tools and ran. The dam is still leaking. We are wet, unpaid, and the town is probably going to flood. Bad day.
The hero missed the intercept. The pie hit the Mayor square in the face. It was blueberry. He looks ridiculous. He fired us on the spot while wiping jam from his eyes.
We looked away for one second. The cat is now bald. It looks like a raw chicken. The Guildmaster is horrified. We have to knit a sweater for the cat. Humiliation.
The ghosts scared the buyers away. The auction was cancelled. The merchant is stuck with the cursed amulet. He is blaming us for the lack of ghost-busting skills. No commission.
The Healer wandered off while we were fighting a wolf. We lost her for three hours. We found her having tea with a woodcutter. She scolded us for being slow. Zero pay.
Tentacles burst through the ice! The fishermen panicked and ran. The kraken stole the prize trout and a bucket of bait. The tournament is ruined, and we smell like fishy failure.

name: Defend
description: Defend the Great Snow Fort! The neighborhood kids have hired mercenaries (older teenagers) to storm our walls. We must hold the line using snowballs and intimidation tactics.
Defend the Guild's pantry! A swarm of giant rats has tunneled into the cellar. They are after the cheese. Hold the chokepoint at the stairs and do not let them reach the cheddar!
Defend the Hot Springs! A troop of Snow Monkeys wants to take over our relaxing pool. They are aggressive and throw fruit. Keep the pool for the heroes only!
Defend the town gate! A horde of 'Sales-Goblins' is trying to enter to sell us extended warranties for our swords. Do not let them in, or we will never hear the end of it.
Defend the crashed airship! It's full of gold. Bandits are approaching from the treeline. Use the wreckage as cover and repel the looters until the recovery team arrives.
Defend the Christmas Tree! The 'Grinch Gang' wants to steal the decorations. Set up traps and guard the ornaments. The spirit of the holidays depends on this tree standing tall.
Defend the Wizard's ritual circle. He is casting a spell to stop the blizzard. Nightmare creatures are drawn to the magic. Keep the circle clear for 10 minutes. No pressure.
Defend the bridge! It's the only way into town. A giant Ice Golem is walking towards it. He doesn't want to fight, he's just heavy and will break it. Turn him around!
Defend the sleeping dragon. Poachers are coming to steal its scales. If the dragon wakes up, it eats everyone. Stop the poachers quietly without disturbing the beast.
Defend the lighthouse. The flame attracts ice-moths the size of eagles. If the light goes out, ships will crash. Smack the moths away with brooms and swords.
success: The fort holds! The teenagers retreated after a barrage of ice-balls. The kids cheered. We are the kings of the snow castle. We feel a bit silly, but a win is a win.
The cheese is safe! The rats were driven back into the dark. We boarded up the tunnel. The cook made us a fondue to celebrate. A delicious victory for the guild.
The monkeys were repelled! We threw bananas into the woods to distract them. The hot spring is ours. The heroes soaked in the warm water, victorious and relaxed.
The gate is sealed! The goblins gave up and went to annoy the next town. We are safe from spam and scams. The town council thanked us for preserving the peace.
The gold is safe! The bandits took one look at our defense and ran. The recovery team arrived and loaded the loot. We got a nice cut of the treasure for standing guard.
The tree sparkles! The Grinch Gang fell into our tinsel traps. The decorations are safe. The town gathered around to sing carols. We felt a warm fuzzy feeling in our hearts.
The spell is complete! The blizzard stopped instantly. The sun is out. The wizard thanked us for keeping the nightmares at bay. We saved the weather!
The bridge stands! We convinced the Golem to walk across the frozen river instead. He waved goodbye. The town is connected, and we didn't have to fight a mountain of rock.
The dragon slept through it all. We tied up the poachers and left them for the guards. The dragon is safe, and we didn't get roasted. The perfect stealth defense.
The light burns bright! The moths are gone (or have a headache). The ships navigated safely to the harbor. The lighthouse keeper gave us a lantern as a souvenir.
loses: We lost the fort. The teenagers had a catapult. We were buried in snow. The flag was captured. The neighborhood kids are crying. We have been shamed by children.
The rats won. They overran the cellar. We had to retreat and lock the door. We can hear them eating the cheese. The cook is weeping. We are eating hardtack for weeks.
The monkeys took over. They are currently soaking in the pool, wearing our towels. We are freezing on the edge. It's their guild now. We are too embarrassed to tell anyone.
They got in. The goblins are everywhere. Every hero now owns five warranties for a 'magic spoon'. We are broke and annoyed. The guild hall is full of pamphlets.
We were overrun. The bandits swarmed the wreckage. We had to flee. They took the gold. We are alive, but the guild is poorer, and the airship is just scrap metal now.
The tree is bare. They stole the star and the baubles. It's just a sad pine tree now. The town is disappointed. Christmas is cancelled. We are the Grinches by association.
A monster broke the circle. The spell backfired. It is now snowing frogs. The wizard is angry. We are covered in slime. The blizzard is worse. Complete magical failure.
The Golem stepped on the bridge. CRUNCH. The bridge is gone. The Golem fell in the water and is confused. We are cut off from the world. The Mayor is screaming at us.
The poachers made a noise. The dragon woke up. It burned the poachers. It singed our eyebrows. We ran away very fast. The dragon is awake and grumpy. Bad job.
The moths swarmed the light. It went out. A ship crashed into the dock (gently). The captain is yelling. We are in the dark, fighting giant bugs. A chaotic disaster.

name: Survive
description: Survive the 'Great Whiteout'. A magical blizzard has hit. Visibility is zero. Temperature is -40. The heroes must huddle in a cave, ration their food, and not let the space-madness set in.
Survive dinner at the Guildmaster's house. His cooking is legendary... for being poisonous. You must eat it to be polite. Survive the indigestion and the awkward conversation.
Survive the 'Night of the Living Snowmen'. They have come to life and they are evil. Survive until sunrise without getting frozen or turned into a decoration.
The heroes are trapped in a collapsed ice mine. Oxygen is fine, but it's dark and scary. Survive the claustrophobia and the eerie sounds until the rescue team digs you out.
Survive the annual Guild Audit. The tax inspector is here. He is boring and ruthless. Survive the paperwork, the questions, and the urge to jump out the window.
Stranded on an ice floe! The ship sank. The heroes are floating on a piece of ice. Survive the cold, the hungry sharks, and the arguments about who is the heaviest.
Survive the fashion show. The heroes were tricked into modeling 'Winter Collection'. The clothes are itchy and ridiculous. Survive the runway without tripping or dying of embarrassment.
Survive the haunted cabin. We rented it for a retreat, but the furniture is flying around. Survive the night without fleeing in terror. It builds character!
Survive the 'flu season'. Everyone in the guild is sick except this team. You must survive the demands of 50 whiny, sneezing heroes without catching the plague yourselves.
Survive the trap room. You walked into a dungeon room and the door locked. The walls are closing in (slowly). Solve the puzzles to survive before you become a hero-sandwich.
success: The storm broke! The sun is out. We survived with all fingers and toes intact. We bonded over the shared trauma of freezing. The team is stronger than ever.
We ate it all. We felt terrible, but we held it down. The Guildmaster was so happy. We were sick for two days, but we kept our jobs. A diplomatic victory of the stomach.
Sunrise! The snowmen melted back into slush. We are exhausted and covered in snow, but alive. We will never look at a carrot the same way again.
They dug us out! We emerged blinking into the light. We found a vein of gold while waiting, so it wasn't a total waste. We are just happy to see the sky.
The audit is over. We passed! The inspector left. We are mentally drained, but the guild is legal for another year. We celebrated by burning the tax forms.
Land ho! The current carried us to shore. We are wet and cold, but safe. The sharks went hungry. We kissed the ground. Never getting on a boat again.
The show is over. We didn't trip! The audience loved it. We are 'fashion icons' now. We burned the clothes immediately, but the fame remains.
Morning came. The ghosts went to sleep. We didn't sleep a wink, but we proved we are brave. The rental deposit was returned. We are leaving a bad review.
The plague has passed. The sick are recovering. We didn't get sick! We are exhausted from fetching soup and tissues, but the guild is back on its feet.
The door opened! We solved the puzzle with seconds to spare. The walls stopped. We are alive and feeling very smart. Let's never go in that room again.
loses: We couldn't take it. We ran out into the storm to find help. We got lost immediately. Rescued by a St. Bernard dog who looked at us with pity. Frostbite and shame.
We couldn't do it. A hero vomited on the table. The dinner ended abruptly. The Guildmaster is offended. We are on latrine duty for a month as punishment.
They got us. We were buried in snow and turned into statues. The sun came up and thawed us out, but we spent the night as lawn ornaments. Humiliating.
Panic set in. We started screaming. The rescuers heard us crying. They pulled us out, but we left our dignity in the mine. Everyone knows we are afraid of the dark.
We failed. The inspector found an error. He fined us heavily. We spent the whole day doing math and still lost money. The most boring defeat in history.
The ice broke. We fell in. We swam to shore, freezing and miserable. We lost our boots in the ocean. We walked home barefoot in the snow. A survival failure.
A hero tripped. He fell off the runway into the front row. The audience laughed. The clothes ripped. We are the laughing stock of the fashion world. Career over.
We ran away. The first time a chair moved, we smashed a window and fled. We left our gear behind. The ghosts won. We are sleeping outside tonight.
We caught it. Now the whole team is sick too. The guild is a quarantine zone. Nobody is doing any missions. The soup has run out. Misery loves company.
We couldn't solve it. The walls squeezed us. Okay, they stopped before killing us, but we were trapped like sardines until the janitor let us out. We feel very flat.
